column1: With shortness of breath you might feel: - Uncomfortable - Like you are not getting enough air - Trouble breathing - Tired - Like you are breathing faster - Fear, anxiety, anger, sadness, helplessness You might notice your skin has a bluish tinge on your fingers, toes, nose, ears, or face.
The nurse may check how much oxygen is in your blood by connecting your fingertip to a machine called a pulse oximeter.
To help with shortness of breath, try: - Sitting up - Sitting or sleeping in a reclining chair - Raising the head of the bed or using pillows to sit up - Leaning forward Find ways to relax.
